intro: Corsia boridiensis, commonly known as the Boridiensian corsia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
